<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	PART I
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Safe Harbor
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Statements in this document that are not historical facts,
	including statements that (i)&nbsp;are in the future tense; (ii)&nbsp;include the words &#147;expects,&#148; &#147;plans,&#148; &#147;targets,&#148; &#147;estimates,&#148; &#147;believes,&#148; &#147;anticipates,&#148; or similar words that
	reference
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Incorporated
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(&#147;Snap-on&#148;
</FONT>
	or &#147;the company&#148;) or its management; (iii)&nbsp;are specifically identified as forward-looking; or
	(iv)&nbsp;describe
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	or management&#146;s future outlook, plans, estimates, objectives or goals, are forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act
	of 1995.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	cautions the reader that any forward-looking statements included in this document that are based upon assumptions and estimates were developed by management in good faith and are subject to
	risks, uncertainties or other factors that could cause (and in some cases have caused) actual results to differ materially from those described in any such statement. Accordingly, forward-looking statements should not be relied upon as a prediction
	of actual results or regarded as a representation by the company or its management that the projected results will be achieved. For those forward-looking statements,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	cautions the reader that numerous
	important factors, such as those listed below, as well as those factors discussed in this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K,
</FONT>
	particularly those in &#147;Item&nbsp;1A: Risk Factors,&#148; could affect the
	company&#146;s actual results and could cause its actual consolidated results to differ materially from those expressed in any forward-looking statement made by, or on behalf of,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	These risks and uncertainties include, without limitation, uncertainties related to estimates, statements, assumptions and projections
	generally, and the timing and progress with which
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	can attain value through its
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Value Creation Processes, including its ability to realize efficiencies
	and savings from its rapid continuous improvement and other cost reduction initiatives, improve workforce productivity, achieve improvements in the company&#146;s manufacturing footprint and greater efficiencies in its supply chain, and enhance
	machine maintenance, plant productivity and manufacturing line
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	set-up
</FONT>
	and change-over practices, any or all of which could result in production inefficiencies, higher costs and/or lost revenues. These risks
	also include uncertainties related to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	capability to implement future strategies with respect to its existing businesses, its ability to refine its brand and franchise strategies, retain and
	attract franchisees, further enhance service and value to franchisees and thereby help improve their sales and profitability, introduce successful new products, successfully pursue, complete and integrate acquisitions, as well as its ability to
	withstand disruption arising from natural disasters, planned facility closures or other labor interruptions, the effects of external negative factors, including adverse developments in world financial markets, weakness in certain areas of the global
	economy (including as a result of the United Kingdom&#146;s vote to exit the European Union), and significant changes in the current competitive environment, inflation, interest rates and other monetary and market fluctuations, changes in tax rates
	and regulations, and the impact of energy and raw material supply and pricing, including steel and gasoline, the amount, rate and growth of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	general and administrative expenses, including health
	care and postretirement costs (resulting from, among other matters, U.S. health care legislation and its ongoing implementation or reform), continuing and potentially increasing required contributions to pension and postretirement plans, the impacts
	of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-strategic
</FONT>
	business and/or product line rationalizations, and the effects on business as a result of new legislation, regulations or government-related developments or issues, risks associated with data
	security and technological systems and protections, and other world or local events outside
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	control, including terrorist disruptions.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	disclaims
	any responsibility to update any forward-looking statement provided in this document, except as required by law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition,
	investors should be aware that generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America (&#147;GAAP&#148;) prescribe when a company should reserve for particular risks, including litigation exposures. Accordingly, results for a given
	reporting period could be significantly affected if and when a reserve is established for a major contingency. Reported results, therefore, may appear to be volatile in certain accounting periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Fiscal Year
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Snap-on&#146;s fiscal year ends on the Saturday that is on or nearest to December 31. Unless otherwise indicated, references in this
	document to &#147;fiscal 2016&#148; or &#147;2016&#148; refer to the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016; references to &#147;fiscal 2015&#148; or &#147;2015&#148; refer to the fiscal year ended January&nbsp;2, 2016; and references to
	&#147;fiscal 2014&#148; or &#147;2014&#148; refer to the fiscal year ended January&nbsp;3, 2015.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	2016 and 2015 fiscal years each contained 52 weeks of operating results;
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	2014 fiscal year contained 53 weeks of operating results. References in this document to 2016, 2015 and 2014 year end refer to December&nbsp;31, 2016, January&nbsp;2, 2016, and January&nbsp;3, 2015,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D308837D10K_HTM_TX308837_1">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;1: Business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	was incorporated under the laws of the state of Wisconsin in 1920 and reincorporated
	under the laws of the state of Delaware in 1930.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	is a leading global innovator, manufacturer and marketer of tools, equipment, diagnostics, repair information and systems solutions for professional
	users performing critical tasks. Products and services include hand and power tools, tool storage, diagnostics software, information and management systems, shop equipment and other solutions for vehicle dealerships and repair centers, as well as
	for customers in industries, including aviation and aerospace, agriculture, construction, government and military, mining, natural resources, power generation and technical education.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	also derives
	income from various financing programs designed to facilitate the sales of its products and support its franchise business.
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	markets its products and brands worldwide through multiple sales distribution channels in more than 130 countries.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	largest geographic markets include the United States, Europe, Canada and Asia/Pacific.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	reaches its customers through the company&#146;s
	franchisee, company-direct, distributor and internet channels.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	originated the mobile tool distribution channel in the automotive repair market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The company began with the development of the original
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	interchangeable socket set in 1920
	and subsequently pioneered mobile tool distribution in the automotive repair market, where fully stocked vans sell to professional vehicle technicians at their place of business. Today,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	defines its
	value proposition more broadly, extending its reach &#147;beyond the garage&#148; to deliver a broad array of unique solutions that make work easier for serious professionals performing critical tasks. The company&#146;s &#147;coherent growth&#148;
	strategy focuses on developing and expanding its professional customer base in its legacy automotive market, as well as in adjacent markets, additional geographies and other areas, including in critical industries, where the cost and penalties for
	failure can be high. In addition to its coherent growth strategy,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	is committed to its &#147;Value Creation Processes&#148; &#150; a set of strategic principles and processes designed to create value
	and employed in the areas of (i)&nbsp;safety; (ii) quality; (iii)&nbsp;customer connection; (iv)&nbsp;innovation; and (v)&nbsp;rapid continuous improvement (&#147;RCI&#148;).
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	RCI initiatives
	employ a structured set of tools and processes across multiple businesses and geographies intended to eliminate waste and improve operations. Savings from
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	RCI initiatives reflect benefits from a
	wide variety of ongoing efficiency, productivity and process improvements, including savings generated from product design cost reductions, improved manufacturing line
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	set-up
</FONT>
	and change-over practices,
	lower-cost sourcing initiatives and facility consolidations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	primary
	customer segments include: (i)&nbsp;commercial and industrial customers, including professionals in critical industries and emerging markets; (ii)&nbsp;professional vehicle repair technicians who purchase products through the company&#146;s
	worldwide mobile tool distribution network; and (iii)&nbsp;other professional customers related to vehicle repair, including owners and managers of independent and original equipment manufacturer (&#147;OEM&#148;) dealership service and repair shops
	(&#147;OEM dealerships&#148;).
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	Financial Services customer segment includes: (i)&nbsp;franchisees&#146; customers and certain other customers of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	who require financing for the purchase or lease of tools and diagnostics and equipment products on an extended-term payment plan; and (ii)&nbsp;franchisees who require financing for business loans and vehicle leases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	business segments are based on the organization structure used by management for
	making operating and investment decisions and for assessing performance.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	reportable business segments are: (i)&nbsp;the Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group; (ii)&nbsp;the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group; (iii)&nbsp;the Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information Group; and (iv)&nbsp;Financial Services. The Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group consists of business operations serving a broad range of
	industrial and commercial customers worldwide, including customers in the aerospace, natural resources, government, power generation, transportation and technical education market segments (collectively, &#147;critical industries&#148;), primarily
	through direct and distributor channels. The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group consists of business operations primarily serving vehicle service and repair technicians through the company&#146;s worldwide mobile tool
	distribution channel. The Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information Group consists of business operations serving other professional vehicle repair customers worldwide, primarily owners and managers of independent repair shops and OEM dealerships,
	through direct and distributor channels. Financial Services consists of the business operations of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Credit LLC (&#147;SOC&#148;), the company&#146;s financial services business in the United States, and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	other financial services subsidiaries in those international markets where
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has franchise operations. See Note 18 to the Consolidated Financial
	Statements for information on business segments and foreign operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

<TD WIDTH="31%">
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	4
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	SNAP-ON INCORPORATED
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	evaluates the performance of its
	operating segments based on segment revenues, including both external and intersegment net sales, and segment operating earnings.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	accounts for intersegment sales and transfers based primarily on
	standard costs with reasonable
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mark-ups
</FONT>
	established between the segments. Identifiable assets by segment are those assets used in the respective reportable segment&#146;s operations. Corporate assets consist
	of cash and cash equivalents (excluding cash held at Financial Services), deferred income taxes and certain other assets. All significant intersegment amounts are eliminated to arrive at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	consolidated financial results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Recent Acquisitions
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On November&nbsp;16, 2016,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	acquired Ryeson Corporation (d/b/a Sturtevant Richmont) for a preliminary cash purchase price of $12.9&nbsp;million (or
	$12.5&nbsp;million, net of cash acquired). The preliminary purchase price is subject to change based upon the finalization of a working capital adjustment that is expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2017. Sturtevant Richmont, based in
	Carol Stream, Illinois, designs, manufactures and distributes mechanical and electronic torque wrenches as well as wireless torque error proofing systems for a variety of industrial applications. The acquisition of Sturtevant Richmont enhanced and
	expanded
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	capabilities in providing solutions that address torque requirements, which are increasingly essential to critical mechanical performance. For segment reporting purposes, the results of
	operations and assets of Sturtevant Richmont have been included in the Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group since the acquisition date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On October&nbsp;31, 2016,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	acquired
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	Holding AB
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(&#147;Car-O-Liner&#148;)
</FONT>
</FONT>
	for a preliminary cash purchase price of $151.8&nbsp;million (or $147.9&nbsp;million, net of cash acquired). The preliminary purchase price is
	subject to change based upon the finalization of a working capital adjustment that is expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2017.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner,
</FONT>
</FONT>
	headquartered
	in Gothenburg, Sweden, designs and manufactures collision repair equipment, and information and truck alignment systems.&nbsp;The acquisition of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	complemented
	and increased
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	existing equipment and repair and service information product offerings, broadened its established capabilities in serving vehicle repair facilities and further expanded the
	company&#146;s presence with repair shop owners and managers.&nbsp;For segment reporting purposes, substantially all of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner&#146;s
</FONT>
</FONT>
	results of operations and
	assets have been included in the Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information Group since the acquisition date, with the remaining portions included in the Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On July&nbsp;27, 2015,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	acquired the assets of Ecotechnics S.p.A.
	(&#147;Ecotechnics&#148;) for a cash purchase price of $11.8&nbsp;million. Ecotechnics designs and manufactures vehicle air conditioning service equipment for OEM dealerships and the automotive aftermarket worldwide. The acquisition of the
	Ecotechnics product line complemented and increased
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	existing equipment product offering for OEM dealerships and independent automotive repair shops, broadened its established capabilities in
	serving vehicle repair facilities, and expanded the company&#146;s presence with repair shop owners and managers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On
	May&nbsp;28, 2014,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	acquired substantially all of the assets of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pro-Cut
</FONT>
	International, Inc.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(&#147;Pro-Cut&#148;)
</FONT>
	for a
	cash purchase price of $41.3&nbsp;million.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pro-Cut
</FONT>
	designs, manufactures and distributes
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	on-car
</FONT>
	brake lathes, related equipment and accessories used in brake servicing
	by automotive repair facilities. The acquisition of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pro-Cut
</FONT>
	product line complemented and increased
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	existing undercar equipment product offering,
	broadened its established capabilities in serving vehicle repair facilities and expanded the company&#146;s presence with repair shop owners and managers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For segment reporting purposes, the results of operations and assets of Ecotechnics and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pro-Cut
</FONT>
	have been included in the Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information
	Group since the respective acquisition dates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Pro forma financial information has not been presented for any of these
	acquisitions as the net effects, individually and collectively, were neither significant nor material to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	results of operations or financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">

	Information Available on the Company&#146;s Website

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

</FONT>
	and its products is available on the company&#146;s
	website at
<U>
	www.snapon.com
</U>
	.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	is not including the information contained on its website as a part of, or incorporating it by reference into, this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	Annual Reports on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K,
</FONT>
	Quarterly Reports on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-Q,
</FONT>
	Proxy
	Statements on Schedule 14A and Current Reports on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	8-K,
</FONT>
	as well as any amendments to those reports, are made available to the public at no charge, other than an investor&#146;s own internet access charges,
	through the Investor Information section of the company&#146;s website at
<U>
	www.snapon.com
</U>
	.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	makes such material available on its website as soon as reasonably practicable after it electronically
	files such material with, or furnishes it to, the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;). Copies of any materials the company files with the SEC can also be obtained free of charge through the SEC&#146;s website at
<U>
	www.sec.gov
</U>
	.
	The SEC&#146;s Public Reference Room can be contacted at 100 F Street, N.E., Washington, D.C. 20549, or by calling
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	1-800-732-0330.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
	In addition,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	(i)&nbsp;charters for the Audit, Corporate
	Governance and Nominating, and Organization and Executive Compensation Committees of the company&#146;s Board of Directors; (ii)&nbsp;Corporate Governance Guidelines; and (iii)&nbsp;Code of Business Conduct and Ethics are available on the
	company&#146;s website.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	will also post any amendments to these documents, or information about any waivers granted to directors or executive officers with respect to the Code of Business Conduct and
	Ethics, on the company&#146;s website at
<U>
	www.snapon.com
</U>
	.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Products and Services
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Tools, Diagnostics and Repair Information, and Equipment
</I>
</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	offers a broad line of products and complementary services that are grouped into three product categories: (i)&nbsp;tools; (ii) diagnostics and repair
	information; and (iii)&nbsp;equipment. Further product line information is not presented as it is not practicable to do so. The following table shows the consolidated net sales of these product categories for the last three years:

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
<I>
	tools
</I>
	product category includes hand tools, power tools and tool storage products. Hand tools
	include wrenches, sockets, ratchet wrenches, pliers, screwdrivers, punches and chisels, saws and cutting tools, pruning tools, torque measuring instruments and other similar products. Power tools include cordless (battery), pneumatic (air),
	hydraulic and corded (electric) tools, such as impact wrenches, ratchets, screwdrivers, drills, sanders, grinders and similar products. Tool storage includes tool chests, roll cabinets and other similar products. For many industrial customers,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	creates specific, engineered solutions, including facility-level tool control and asset management hardware and software, custom kits in a wide range of configurations, and custom-built tools designed to
	meet customer requirements. The majority of products are manufactured by
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	and, in completing the product offering, other items are purchased from external manufacturers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
<I>
	diagnostics and repair information
</I>
	product category includes handheld and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	PC-based
</FONT>
	diagnostic products, service and repair information products, diagnostic software solutions, electronic parts catalogs, business management systems and services,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	point-of-sale
</FONT>
</FONT>
	systems, integrated systems for vehicle service shops, OEM purchasing facilitation services, and warranty management systems and analytics to help OEM
	dealerships manage and track performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
<I>
	equipment
</I>
	product category includes solutions for the diagnosis and
	service of vehicles and industrial equipment. Products include wheel alignment equipment, wheel balancers, tire changers, vehicle lifts, test lane systems, collision repair equipment, vehicle air conditioning service equipment, brake service
	equipment, fluid exchange equipment, transmission troubleshooting equipment, safety testing equipment, battery chargers and hoists.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="35%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%">
</TD>

<B>
	6
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">

<B>
	SNAP-ON INCORPORATED

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	supports the sale of its diagnostics and
	vehicle service shop equipment by offering training programs as well as after-sales support for its customers, primarily focusing on the technologies and the application of specific products developed and marketed by
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Products are marketed under a number of brand names and trademarks, many of
	which are well known in the vehicle service and industrial markets served. Some of the major trade names and trademarks and the products and services with which they are associated include the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

</FONT>

</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="35%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	2016 ANNUAL REPORT
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	7
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Financial Services
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	also generates revenue from various financing programs that include: (i)&nbsp;installment
	sales and lease contracts arising from franchisees&#146; customers and certain other customers of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	who require financing for the purchase or lease of tools and diagnostic and equipment products on an
	extended-term payment plan; and (ii)&nbsp;business loans and vehicle leases to franchisees. The decision to finance through
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	or another financing source is solely at the customer&#146;s election. When
	assessing customers for potential financing,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	considers various factors regarding ability to pay, including the customers&#146; financial condition, debt-servicing ability, past payment experience, and
	credit bureau and proprietary Snap-on credit model information, as well as the value of the underlying collateral.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	offers financing through SOC and the company&#146;s international finance subsidiaries in those markets where
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has franchise operations. Financing revenue from
	contract originations is recognized over the life of the underlying contracts, with interest computed primarily on the average daily balances of the underlying contracts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Sales and Distribution
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	markets and distributes its products and related services principally to professional
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
	tool and equipment users around the world. The two largest market sectors are the vehicle service and repair sector and the industrial sector.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Vehicle Service and Repair Sector
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The vehicle service and repair sector has three main customer groups: (i)&nbsp;professional technicians who purchase tools and diagnostic and equipment products for use in their work; (ii)&nbsp;other
	professional customers related to vehicle repair, including owners and managers of independent repair shops and OEM dealerships who purchase tools and diagnostic and equipment products for use by multiple technicians within a service or repair
	facility; and (iii)&nbsp;OEMs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	provides innovative tool, equipment and
	business solutions, as well as technical sales support and training, designed to meet technicians&#146; evolving needs.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	mobile tool distribution system offers technicians the convenience of
	purchasing quality tools at their place of business with minimal disruption of their work routine.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	also provides owners and managers of repair shops, where technicians work, with tools, diagnostic
	equipment, and repair and service information, including electronic parts catalogs and shop management products.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	OEM facilitation business provides OEMs with products and services including
	tools, consulting and facilitation services, which include product procurement, distribution and administrative support to customers for their dealership equipment programs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The vehicle service and repair sector is characterized by an increasing rate of technological change within motor vehicles, vehicle population growth and increasing vehicle life, and the resulting effects
	of these changes on the businesses of both our suppliers and customers.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	believes it is a meaningful participant in the vehicle service and repair market sector.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Industrial Sector
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	markets its products and services globally to a broad cross-section of commercial and industrial customers, including maintenance and repair operations; manufacturing and assembly facilities; various
	government agencies, facilities and operations, including military operations; vocational and technical schools; aviation and aerospace operations; oil and gas developers; mining operations; energy and power generation; equipment fabricators and
	operators; railroad manufacturing and maintenance; customers in agriculture; infrastructure construction companies; and other customers that require instrumentation, service tools and/or equipment for their product and business needs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The industrial sector for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	focuses on providing value-added products and services to an
	increasingly expanding global base of customers in critical industries. Through its experienced and dispersed sales organization, industrial &#147;solutioneers&#148; develop unique and highly valued productivity solutions for customers worldwide
	that leverage
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	product, service and development capabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	industrial sector is characterized by a highly competitive, cost-conscious environment, and a trend toward customers making many of their tool and equipment purchases through one integrated supplier. Industrial customers increasingly require
	specialized solutions that provide repeatability and reliability in performing tasks of consequence that are specific to the particular end market in which they operate.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	believes it is a meaningful
	participant in the industrial tools and equipment market sector.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="35%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	8
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	SNAP-ON INCORPORATED
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Distribution Channels
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	serves customers primarily through the following channels of distribution: (i)&nbsp;the mobile van channel; (ii)&nbsp;company direct sales;
	(iii)&nbsp;distributors; and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(iv)&nbsp;e-commerce.
</FONT>
	The following discussion summarizes
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	general approach for each channel, and is not intended to be
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	all-inclusive.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mobile Van Channel
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the United States, a significant portion of sales to the vehicle service and repair sector is conducted through
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	mobile franchise van channel.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	franchisees primarily serve vehicle repair technicians and vehicle service shop owners, generally providing weekly
	contact at the customer&#146;s place of business. Franchisees&#146; sales are concentrated in hand and power tools, tool storage products, shop equipment, and diagnostic and repair information products, which can easily be transported in a van or
	trailer and demonstrated during a brief sales call. Franchisees purchase
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	products at a discount from suggested list prices and resell them at prices established by the franchisee. U.S.
	franchisees are provided a list of calls that serves as the basis of the franchisee&#146;s sales route.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	franchisees also have the opportunity to add a limited number of additional franchises.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	charges nominal initial and ongoing monthly franchise fees.&nbsp;Franchise
	fee revenue, including nominal,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-refundable
</FONT>
	initial and ongoing monthly fees (primarily for sales and business training, and marketing and product promotion programs), is recognized as the fees are earned.
	Franchise fee revenue totaled $13.9&nbsp;million, $12.7&nbsp;million and $12.1&nbsp;million in fiscal 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	also has a company-owned route program that is designed to: (i)&nbsp;provide another pool of potential field organization personnel; (ii)&nbsp;service
	customers in select new and/or open routes not currently serviced by franchisees; and (iii)&nbsp;allow
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	to pilot new sales and promotional ideas prior to introducing them to franchisees. As of&nbsp;2016
	year end,&nbsp;company-owned routes comprised less than 3% of the total route population;
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	may elect to increase or reduce the number of company-owned routes in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition to its mobile van channel in the United States,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has replicated its U.S.
	franchise distribution model in certain other countries including the United Kingdom, Canada, Japan, Australia, Germany, Netherlands, South Africa, New Zealand, Belgium and Ireland. In many of these markets, as in the United States, purchase
	decisions are generally made or influenced by professional vehicle service technicians as well as repair shop owners and managers. As of 2016 year end,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	worldwide route count was approximately
	4,900, including approximately 3,500 routes in the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Through SOC, financing is available to U.S. franchisees,
	including financing for van leases, working capital loans and loans to help enable new franchisees to fund the purchase of the franchise. In many international markets,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	offers a variety of financing
	options to its franchisees and/or customer networks through its international finance subsidiaries.&nbsp;The decision to finance through
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	or another financing source is solely at the customer&#146;s
	election.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	supports its franchisees with a field organization of regional
	offices, franchise performance teams, customer care centers and distribution centers.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	also provides sales and business training, and marketing and product promotion programs, as well as customer and
	franchisee financing programs through SOC and the company&#146;s international finance subsidiaries, all of which are designed to strengthen franchisee sales. National Franchise Advisory Councils in the United States, the United Kingdom, Canada and
	Australia, composed primarily of franchisees that are elected by franchisees, assist
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	in identifying and implementing enhancements to the franchise program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Company Direct Sales
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A
	significant proportion of shop equipment sales in North America under the John Bean, Hofmann, Blackhawk,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner,
</FONT>
</FONT>
	Challenger and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pro-Cut
</FONT>
	brands, diagnostic products under the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	brand and information products under the Mitchell1 brand are made by direct and independent sales forces that have
	responsibility for national and other accounts.&nbsp;As the vehicle service and repair sector consolidates (with more business conducted by national chains and franchised service centers),
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	believes
	these larger organizations can be serviced most effectively by sales people who can demonstrate and sell the full line of diagnostic and equipment products and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	services.&nbsp;Snap-on
</FONT>
	also sells these products
	and services directly to OEMs and their franchised dealers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="35%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="32%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	2016 ANNUAL REPORT
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">

</B>

<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	brand tools and equipment are marketed
	to industrial and governmental customers worldwide through both industrial sales associates and independent distributors. Selling activities focus on industrial customers whose main purchase criteria are quality and integrated solutions. As of 2016
	year end,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	had industrial sales associates and independent distributors primarily in the United States and in various European, Latin American, Middle Eastern, Asian and African countries, with the
	United States representing the majority of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	total industrial sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	also sells software, services and solutions to the automotive, commercial, heavy duty, agriculture, power equipment and power sports segments. Products and services are marketed to targeted groups, including
	OEMs and their dealerships, fleets and individual repair shops. To effectively reach OEMs, which frequently have a multi-national presence,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has deployed focused business teams globally.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Distributors
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sales of
	certain tools and equipment are made through independent distributors who purchase the items from
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	and resell them to end users. Hand tools sold under the BAHCO, Fish and Hook, Irimo, Lindstr&ouml;m,
	CDI, ATI, Sioux, Sturtevant Richmont and Williams brands and trade names, for example, are sold through distributors in Europe, North and South America, Asia and certain other parts of the world. Wheel service and other vehicle service equipment are
	sold through distributors primarily under brands including Hofmann, John Bean,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner,
</FONT>
</FONT>
	Challenger,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pro-Cut,
</FONT>
	Cartec,
	Blackhawk and Ecotechnics. Diagnostic and equipment products are marketed through distributors in South America and Asia, and through both a direct sales force and distributors in Europe under the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on,
</FONT>
	Sun
	and Blue-Point brands.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	E-commerce
</FONT>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	offers current and prospective customers online access to research and purchase products
	through its public website at
<U>
	www.
</U>
<U>
	snapon.com
</U>
	. The site features an online catalog of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	hand tools, power tools, tool storage units and diagnostic equipment available to customers in the
	United States, the United Kingdom, Canada and Australia.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	E-commerce
</FONT>
	and certain other system enhancement initiatives are designed to improve productivity and further leverage the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-on-one
</FONT>
</FONT>
	relationships and service
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has with its current and prospective customers. Sales through the company&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	e-commerce
</FONT>
	distribution channel were not significant in any of the last three years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Competition
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	competes on the basis of its product quality and performance, product
	line breadth and depth, service, brand awareness and imagery, technological innovation and availability of financing (through SOC or its international finance subsidiaries). While
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	does not believe that
	any single company competes with it across all of its product lines and distribution channels, various companies compete in one or more product categories and/or distribution channels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	believes it is a leading manufacturer and distributor of professional tools, tool
	storage, diagnostic and equipment products, and repair software and solutions, offering a broad line of these products to both vehicle service and industrial marketplaces. Various competitors target and sell to professional technicians in the
	vehicle service and repair sector through the mobile tool distribution channel.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	also competes with companies that sell tools and equipment to vehicle service and repair technicians online and through
	retail stores, vehicle parts supply outlets and tool supply warehouses/distributorships. Within the power tools category and the industrial sector,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has various other competitors, including companies
	with offerings that overlap with other areas discussed herein. Major competitors selling diagnostics, shop equipment and information to vehicle dealerships and independent repair shops include OEMs and their proprietary electronic parts catalogs and
	diagnostics and information systems, and other companies that offer products serving this sector.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Raw Materials and Purchased Product
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	supply of raw materials and purchased components are generally and
	readily available from numerous suppliers.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	believes it has secured an ample supply of both bar and coil steel for the near future to ensure stable supply to meet material demands. The company does not
	currently anticipate experiencing any significant impact in 2017 from steel pricing or availability issues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Patents, Trademarks and Other Intellectual Property
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	vigorously pursues and relies on patent protection to protect its intellectual property
	and position in its markets. As of 2016 year end,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	and its subsidiaries held approximately 700 active and pending patents in the United States and approximately 1,600 active and pending patents outside
	of the United States. Sales relating to any single patent did not represent a material portion of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	revenues in any of the last three years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Examples of products that have features or designs that benefit from patent protection include wheel alignment systems, wheel balancers,
	tire changers, vehicle lifts, tool storage, tool control, collision measurement, test lanes, brake lathes, sealed ratchets, electronic torque instruments, ratcheting screwdrivers, emissions-sensing devices and diagnostic equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Much of the technology used in the manufacture of vehicle service tools and equipment is in the public domain.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	relies primarily on trade secret protection to protect proprietary processes used in manufacturing. Methods and processes are patented when appropriate. Copyright protection is also utilized when
	appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Trademarks used by
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	are of continuing importance to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	in the marketplace. Trademarks have been registered in the United States and many other countries, and additional applications for trademark registrations are pending.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	vigorously polices proper use of its trademarks.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	right to manufacture and sell certain products is dependent upon licenses from others; however,
	these products under license do not represent a material portion of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	net sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Domain names have become a valuable corporate asset for companies around the world, including
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on.
</FONT>
	Domain names often contain a trademark or service mark or
	even a corporate name and are often considered intellectual property. The recognition and value of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	name, trademark and domain name are core strengths of the company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	strategically licenses the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	brand to
	carefully selected manufacturing and distribution companies for items such as apparel, work boots, lighting and a variety of other goods, in order to further build brand awareness and market presence for the company&#146;s strongest brand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Environmental
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	is subject to various environmental laws, ordinances, regulations, and other requirements of government authorities in the United States and other nations.
	At
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on,
</FONT>
	these environmental liabilities are managed through the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Environmental, Health and Safety Management System (&#147;EH&nbsp;&amp; SMS&#148;), which is
	applied worldwide. The system is based upon continual improvement and is certified to ISO 14001:2004 and OHSAS 18001:2007, verified through Det Norske Veritas (DNV) Certification, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	believes that it complies with applicable environmental control requirements in its
	operations. Expenditures on environmental matters through EH&nbsp;&amp; SMS have not had, and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	does not for the foreseeable future expect them to have, a material effect upon
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	capital expenditures, earnings or competitive position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Employees
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	employed approximately 12,100 people at the end of January 2017;
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	employed approximately 11,500 people at the end of January 2016. The year-over-year increase in employees primarily reflects the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	and Sturtevant Richmont acquisitions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Approximately 2,800 employees, or 23% of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	worldwide workforce, are represented by unions and/or covered under collective bargaining agreements. The
	number of covered union employees whose contracts expire over the next five years approximates 2,100 employees in 2017, 500 employees in 2018, and 200 employees in 2019; there are no contracts currently scheduled to expire in 2020 or 2021. In recent
	years,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has not experienced any significant work slowdowns, stoppages or other labor disruptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	There can be no assurance that these and other future contracts with
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	unions will be renegotiated upon terms acceptable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Working Capital
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Most of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	businesses are not seasonal and their inventory needs are relatively constant.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	did not have a
	significant backlog of orders at 2016 year end. In recent years,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has been using its working capital to fund, in part, the continued growth of the company&#146;s financial services portfolio and the
	acquisitions discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	liquidity and capital resources and use
	of working capital are discussed herein in &#147;Part II, Item 7, Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of 2016 year end, neither
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	nor any of its segments depend on any single customer, small group of customers or government for any material part of its
	revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_BUSINESS>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D308837D10K_HTM_TX308837_2">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;1A: Risk Factors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In evaluating the company, careful consideration should be given to the following risk factors, in addition to the other information
	included in this Annual Report on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	10-K,
</FONT>
	including the Consolidated Financial Statements and the related notes. Each of these risk factors could adversely affect the company&#146;s business, operating
	results, cash flows and/or financial condition, as well as adversely affect the value of an investment in the company&#146;s common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Economic conditions and world events could affect our operating results.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We, our franchisees and our customers, may be adversely affected by changing economic conditions, including conditions that may
	particularly impact specific regions. These conditions may result in reduced consumer and investor confidence, instability in the credit and financial markets, volatile corporate profits, and reduced business and consumer spending. We, our
	franchisees and our customers, and the economy as a whole, also may be affected by future world or local events outside our control, such as acts of terrorism, developments in the war on terrorism, conflicts in international situations and natural
	disasters, as well as government-related developments or issues. These factors may affect our results of operations by reducing our sales, margins and/or net earnings as a result of a slowdown in customer orders or order cancellations, impact the
	availability of raw materials and/or the supply chain, and could potentially lead to future impairment of our intangible assets. In addition, political and social turmoil related to international conflicts and terrorist acts may put pressure on
	economic conditions abroad. Unstable political, social and economic conditions may make it difficult for our franchisees, customers, suppliers and us to accurately forecast and plan future business activities. If such conditions persist, our
	business, financial condition, results of operations and cash flows could be negatively affected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In June 2016, the United
	Kingdom voted in a referendum to exit the European Union (&#147;Brexit&#148;), which resulted in significant currency exchange rate fluctuations and volatility beginning late in the second quarter of fiscal 2016. Subject to parliamentary approval,
	the British government is expected to commence negotiations to determine the terms of Brexit. Given the lack of comparable precedent, the implications of Brexit, or how such implications might affect
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on,
</FONT>
	are unclear at this time. Brexit could, among other impacts, disrupt trade and the movement of goods, services and people between the United Kingdom and the European Union or other countries as well as create legal and global economic uncertainty.
	These and other potential implications could adversely affect our business and results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Raw material and energy price
	fluctuations and shortages (including steel and various fuel sources) could adversely affect the ability to obtain needed manufacturing materials and could adversely affect our results of operations.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The principal raw material used in the manufacture of our products is steel, which we purchase in competitive, price-sensitive markets.
	To meet
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	high quality standards, our steel needs range from specialized alloys, which are available only from a limited group of approved suppliers, to commodity types of alloys. These raw
	materials have historically exhibited price and demand cyclicality. Some of these materials have been, and in the future may be, in short supply, particularly in the event of mill shutdowns or production cut backs. As some steel alloys require
	specialized manufacturing procedures, we could experience inventory shortages if we were required to use an alternative manufacturer on short notice. Additionally, unexpected price increases for raw materials could result in higher prices to our
	customers or an erosion of the margins on our products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TR>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	12
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	SNAP-ON INCORPORATED
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
