<A NAME="eolPage28"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<I>
	Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
	(continued)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating earnings of $854.2&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $89.4&nbsp;million, or
	11.7%, from $764.8&nbsp;million last year. In 2016, net earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Incorporated were $546.4&nbsp;million or $9.20 per diluted share. Net earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Incorporated in 2015 were $478.7&nbsp;million or $8.10 per diluted share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
<B>
	Commercial
</B>
<B>
</B>
<B>
	&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group
</B>
	consists of business operations serving a broad range of industrial and commercial customers worldwide, including customers in the aerospace, natural resources, government, power
	generation, transportation and technical education market segments (collectively, &#147;critical industries&#148;), primarily through direct and distributor channels. Segment net sales of $1,148.3&nbsp;million in 2016 decreased $15.3&nbsp;million,
	or 1.3%, from 2015 levels, reflecting $20.6&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation partially offset by $4.2&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales and a $1.1&nbsp;million, or 0.1%, organic sales gain. The organic sales increase
	primarily includes higher sales in the segment&#146;s European-based hand tools business and in its Asia/Pacific and power tools operations, largely offset by lower sales to customers in critical industries, primarily in the international aerospace
	and natural resources market segments. Operating earnings of $168.0&nbsp;million in 2016 decreased $1.4&nbsp;million, or 0.8%, from 2015 levels, including $1.1&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group intends to continue building on the following strategic priorities in 2017:
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Continuing to reduce structural and operating costs through RCI initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
<B>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group
</B>
	consists of business operations primarily serving vehicle service
	and repair technicians through the company&#146;s worldwide mobile tool distribution channel.
<B>
</B>
	Segment net sales of $1,633.9&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $65.2&nbsp;million, or 4.2%, from 2015 levels, reflecting an $86.4&nbsp;million, or
	5.6%, organic sales gain partially offset by $21.2&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The organic sales increase includes higher sales in both the company&#146;s U.S. and international franchise operations. Operating earnings
	of $281.1&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $25.1&nbsp;million, or 9.8%, from 2015 levels, primarily as a result of higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives, partially offset by $15.3&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group made continued progress in 2016 on its fundamental, strategic
	initiatives to strengthen the franchise network and enhance franchisee profitability. In 2017, the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group intends to further build on the progress made in 2016, with specific initiatives focused
	on the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	as well as its
	franchisees, will have the opportunity to continue to serve customers more effectively, more profitably and with improved satisfaction.

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
<B>
	Repair Systems
</B>
<B>
</B>
<B>
	&nbsp;&amp;
</B>
<B>
	Information Group
</B>
	consists of business operations serving other professional vehicle repair customers worldwide, primarily owners and managers of
	independent repair shops and OEM dealership service and repair shops (&#147;OEM dealerships&#148;), through direct and distributor channels. Segment net sales of $1,179.9&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $66.7&nbsp;million, or 6.0%, from 2015 levels,
	reflecting a $52.1&nbsp;million, or 4.7%, organic sales gain and $28.7&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales, partially offset by $14.1&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The organic sales increase primarily reflects
	higher sales to independent repair shop owners and managers, as well as increased sales to OEM dealerships, including higher sales of diagnostic and repair information products, and increased sales of undercar equipment. Operating earnings of
	$297.8&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $24.4&nbsp;million, or 8.9%, from 2015 levels, primarily due to higher sales, including acquisition-related sales, and savings from RCI initiatives, partially offset by $5.1&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign
	currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Financial Services
</B>
	revenue was $281.4&nbsp;million in 2016 and $240.3&nbsp;million in 2015; originations of $1,075.7&nbsp;million
	in 2016 increased $82.0&nbsp;million, or 8.3%, from 2015 levels.&nbsp;In recent years,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	has steadily grown its financial services portfolio by providing financing for new finance and contract
	receivables originated by our global financial services operations. In 2016, operating earnings from financial services of $198.7&nbsp;million increased $28.5&nbsp;million, or 16.7%, from $170.2&nbsp;million last year, including $1.8&nbsp;million of
	unfavorable foreign currency effects.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial Services intends to focus on the following strategic
	priorities in 2017:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cash Flows
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash provided by operating activities of
	$576.1&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $68.9&nbsp;million from $507.2&nbsp;million in 2015 primarily due to $69.0&nbsp;million of higher net earnings. Net cash provided by operating activities was $403.1&nbsp;million in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used by investing activities of $473.4&nbsp;million in 2016 included additions to finance receivables of $915.0&nbsp;million,
	partially offset by collections of $671.7&nbsp;million. It also included, on a preliminary basis, a total of $160.4&nbsp;million (net of $4.3&nbsp;million of cash acquired) for the acquisitions of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	and Sturtevant Richmont. Net cash used by investing activities of $306.4&nbsp;million in 2015 included additions to finance receivables of $844.2&nbsp;million, partially offset by collections of
	$624.8&nbsp;million, as well as $11.8&nbsp;million for the acquisition of Ecotechnics. Net cash used by investing activities of $273.2&nbsp;million in 2014 included additions to finance receivables of $746.2&nbsp;million, partially offset by
	collections of $591.4&nbsp;million, as well as $41.3&nbsp;million for the acquisition of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Pro-Cut.
</FONT>
	Capital expenditures in 2016, 2015 and 2014 totaled $74.3&nbsp;million, $80.4&nbsp;million and
	$80.6&nbsp;million, respectively. Capital expenditures in all three years included investments to support the company&#146;s execution of its strategic growth initiatives and Value Creation Processes around safety, quality, customer connection,
	innovation and RCI.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used by financing activities of $116.0&nbsp;million in 2016 included $147.5&nbsp;million for
	dividend payments to shareholders and $120.4&nbsp;million for the repurchase of 758,000 shares of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	common stock, partially offset by $134.2&nbsp;million of proceeds from a net increase in notes
	payable and other short-term borrowings and $41.8&nbsp;million of proceeds from stock purchase and option plan exercises. Net cash used by financing activities of $236.7&nbsp;million in 2015 included $127.9&nbsp;million for dividend payments to
	shareholders, $110.4&nbsp;million for the repurchase of 723,000 shares of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	common stock and $34.0&nbsp;million from a net decrease in notes payable and other short-term borrowings, partially
	offset by $41.6&nbsp;million of proceeds from stock purchase and option plan exercises. Net cash used by financing activities of $212.1&nbsp;million in 2014 included the repayment of $100&nbsp;million of unsecured notes at maturity. Net cash used by
	financing activities in 2014 also included $107.6&nbsp;million for dividend payments to shareholders and $79.3&nbsp;million for the repurchase of 680,000 shares of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	common stock, partially offset
	by $45.0&nbsp;million of proceeds from a net increase in notes payable and other short-term borrowings and $33.0&nbsp;million of proceeds from stock purchase and option plan exercises.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Fiscal Year
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	fiscal year ends on the Saturday that is on or nearest to December 31. Unless otherwise indicated, references in this Management&#146;s Discussion
	and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations to &#147;fiscal 2016&#148; or &#147;2016&#148; refer to the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016; references to &#147;fiscal 2015&#148; or &#147;2015&#148; refer to the fiscal year
	ended January&nbsp;2, 2016; and references to &#147;fiscal 2014&#148; or &#147;2014&#148; refer to the fiscal year ended January&nbsp;3, 2015. References in this document to 2016, 2015 and 2014 year end refer to December&nbsp;31, 2016,
	January&nbsp;2, 2016, and January&nbsp;3, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	2016 and
	2015 fiscal years each contained 52 weeks of operating results.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	2014 fiscal year contained 53 weeks of operating results; the impact of the additional week of operations was not material to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	full year 2014 net sales or net earnings.
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	NM: Not
	meaningful
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Percentage Disclosure: All income statement line item percentages below &#147;Operating earnings from financial services&#148; are
	calculated as a percentage of the sum of Net sales and Financial services revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net sales of $3,430.4&nbsp;million in 2016
	increased $77.6&nbsp;million, or 2.3%, from 2015 levels, reflecting a $96.2&nbsp;million, or 2.9%, organic sales gain and $32.9&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales, partially offset by $51.5&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency
	translation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Gross profit of $1,709.6&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to $1,648.3&nbsp;million last
	year. Gross margin (gross profit as a percentage of net sales) of 49.8% in 2016 improved 60 basis points (100 basis points (&#147;bps&#148;) equals 1.0 percent) from 49.2% last year as benefits from higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives were
	partially offset by 20 bps of unfavorable foreign currency effects. Restructuring costs included in gross profit were $0.8&nbsp;million and zero in 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating expenses of $1,054.1&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to $1,053.7&nbsp;million last year. The operating expense margin (operating
	expenses as a percentage of net sales) of 30.7% in 2016 improved 80 bps from 31.5% last year primarily due to sales volume leverage and savings from RCI initiatives, 30 bps of lower stock-based
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(mark-to-market)
</FONT>
</FONT>
	compensation and other expenses, including lower costs associated with the company&#146;s employee and franchisee stock purchase plans, and 20 bps of lower pension expense. Restructuring
	costs included in operating expenses were $0.1&nbsp;million and zero in 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating earnings
	before financial services of $655.5&nbsp;million in 2016, including $21.5&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $60.9&nbsp;million, or 10.2%, as compared to $594.6&nbsp;million last year. As a percentage of net sales,
	operating earnings before financial services of 19.1% in 2016 improved 140 bps from 17.7% last year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services
	revenue of $281.4&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to revenue of $240.3&nbsp;million last year. Financial services operating earnings of $198.7&nbsp;million in 2016, including $1.8&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased
	$28.5&nbsp;million, or 16.7%, as compared to $170.2&nbsp;million last year. The year-over-year increases in both revenue and operating earnings primarily reflect continued growth of the company&#146;s financial services portfolio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating earnings of $854.2&nbsp;million in 2016, including $23.3&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased
	$89.4&nbsp;million, or 11.7%, from $764.8&nbsp;million last year. As a percentage of revenues (net sales plus financial services revenue), operating earnings of 23.0% in 2016 improved 170 bps from 21.3% last year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest expense of $52.2&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $0.3&nbsp;million from $51.9&nbsp;million last year. See Note 9 to the
	Consolidated Financial Statements for information on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	debt and credit facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other income (expense) &#150; net was expense of $0.6&nbsp;million and $2.4&nbsp;million in 2016 and 2015, respectively. Other income (expense) &#150; net reflects net losses and gains associated with
	hedging and currency exchange rate transactions, and interest income. See Note 16 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on other income (expense) &#150; net.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	effective income tax rate on earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	was 31.0% in 2016 and 31.7% in 2015. See Note 8 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on income taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	of $546.4&nbsp;million, or $9.20 per diluted share, in 2016 increased $67.7&nbsp;million, or $1.10 per diluted share, from 2015
	levels. Net earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	in 2015 were $478.7&nbsp;million or $8.10 per diluted share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Exit and Disposal Activities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2016, the company&#146;s Repair
	Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information Group recorded $0.9&nbsp;million of severance costs for exit and disposal activities, all of which qualified for accrual treatment; no costs for exit and disposal activities were recorded in 2015. The exit and disposal
	accrual of $2.8&nbsp;million as of 2016 year end is expected to be fully utilized in 2017.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	anticipates funding the remaining cash requirements of its exit and disposal activities with available cash on
	hand, cash flows from operations and borrowings under the company&#146;s existing credit facilities. The estimated costs for the exit and disposal activities were based on management&#146;s best business judgment under prevailing circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Segment Results
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	business segments are based on the organization structure used by management for making operating and investment decisions and for assessing
	performance.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	reportable business segments are: (i)&nbsp;the Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group; (ii)&nbsp;the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group; (iii)&nbsp;the
	Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information Group; and (iv)&nbsp;Financial Services. The Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group consists of business operations serving a broad range of industrial and commercial customers worldwide, including customers in
	the aerospace, natural resources, government, power generation, transportation and technical education market segments (collectively, &#147;critical industries&#148;), primarily through direct and distributor channels. The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group consists of business operations primarily serving vehicle service and repair technicians through the company&#146;s worldwide mobile tool distribution channel. The Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp;
	Information Group consists of business operations serving other professional vehicle repair customers worldwide, primarily owners and managers of independent repair shops and OEM dealerships, through direct and distributor channels. Financial
	Services consists of the business operations of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	finance subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<I>
	Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
	(continued)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	evaluates the performance of its
	operating segments based on segment revenues, including both external and intersegment net sales, and segment operating earnings.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	accounts for intersegment sales and transfers based primarily on
	standard costs with reasonable
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mark-ups
</FONT>
	established between the segments. Identifiable assets by segment are those assets used in the respective reportable segment&#146;s operations. Corporate assets consist
	of cash and cash equivalents (excluding cash held at Financial Services), deferred income taxes and certain other assets. All significant intersegment amounts are eliminated to arrive at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	consolidated financial results.
</FONT>
</P>

</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="6" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="6" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2015
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="6" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $1,148.3&nbsp;million in 2016 decreased $15.3&nbsp;million, or 1.3%, from 2015
	levels, reflecting $20.6&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation partially offset by $4.2&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales and a $1.1&nbsp;million, or 0.1%, organic sales gain. The organic sales increase primarily includes
	a mid single-digit gain in the segment&#146;s European-based hand tools business and low single-digit increases in both the segment&#146;s Asia/Pacific and power tools operations. These organic sales gains were largely offset by a mid single-digit
	decline in sales to customers in critical industries, primarily in the international aerospace and natural resources market segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross profit of $450.0&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to $446.5&nbsp;million last year. Gross margin of 39.2% in 2016 improved 80 bps from 38.4% last year primarily due to savings from RCI and
	other cost reduction initiatives, and 20 bps of favorable foreign currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of
	$282.0&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to $277.1&nbsp;million last year. The operating expense margin of 24.6% in 2016 increased 80 bps from 23.8% last year primarily due to higher costs, including costs associated with continued expansion initiatives
	in Asia, a 20 bps benefit realized in 2015 from a gain on the sale of a former manufacturing facility, and 10 bps of unfavorable foreign currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of these factors, segment operating earnings of $168.0&nbsp;million in 2016, including $1.1&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, decreased $1.4&nbsp;million from 2015 levels.
	Operating margin (segment operating earnings as a percentage of segment net sales) for the Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group was 14.6% in both years.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	SNAP-ON INCORPORATED

<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $1,633.9&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $65.2&nbsp;million, or
	4.2%, from 2015 levels, reflecting an $86.4&nbsp;million, or 5.6%, organic sales gain partially offset by $21.2&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The organic sales increase includes mid single-digit gains in both the
	company&#146;s U.S. and international franchise operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross profit of $704.1&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to
	$683.0&nbsp;million last year. Gross margin of 43.1% in 2016 declined 40 bps from 43.5% last year as 70 bps of unfavorable foreign currency effects were partially offset by benefits from higher sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of $423.0&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to $427.0&nbsp;million last year. The operating expense margin of
	25.9% in 2016 improved 130 bps from 27.2% last year primarily due to sales volume leverage and savings from RCI and other cost reduction initiatives, as well as 20 bps of lower stock-based costs associated with the company&#146;s franchisee stock
	purchase plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of these factors, segment operating earnings of $281.1&nbsp;million in 2016, including
	$15.3&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $25.1&nbsp;million from 2015 levels. Operating margin for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group of 17.2% in 2016 improved 90 bps from 16.3% last year.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $1,179.9&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $66.7&nbsp;million, or 6.0%, from 2015
	levels, reflecting a $52.1&nbsp;million, or 4.7%, organic sales gain and $28.7&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales, partially offset by $14.1&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The organic sales increase includes a high
	single-digit gain in sales of diagnostic and repair information products to independent repair shop owners and managers, and low single-digit increases in both sales of undercar equipment and sales to OEM dealerships.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross profit of $555.5&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to $518.8&nbsp;million last year. Gross margin of 47.1% in 2016 improved 50
	bps from 46.6% last year, as benefits from higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives were partially offset by 10 bps of unfavorable currency effects. Restructuring costs included in gross profit were $0.8&nbsp;million and zero in 2016 and 2015,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of $257.7&nbsp;million in 2016 compared to $245.4&nbsp;million last year. The
	operating expense margin of 21.9% in 2016 improved 10 bps from 22.0% last year primarily due to sales volume leverage and savings from RCI initiatives, partially offset by 20 bps of impact from the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	acquisition. Restructuring costs included in operating expenses were $0.1&nbsp;million and zero in 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of these factors, segment operating earnings of $297.8&nbsp;million in 2016, including $5.1&nbsp;million of unfavorable
	foreign currency effects, increased $24.4&nbsp;million from 2015 levels. Operating margin for the Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information Group of 25.2% in 2016 improved 60 bps from 24.6% last year.
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<I>
	Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
	(continued)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services revenue of $281.4&nbsp;million in 2016 increased $41.1&nbsp;million,
	or 17.1%, from $240.3&nbsp;million last year primarily reflecting $38.1&nbsp;million of higher revenue as a result of continued growth of the company&#146;s financial services portfolio and $2.7&nbsp;million of increased revenue from higher average
	yields on finance receivables. In 2016 and 2015, the respective average yield on finance receivables was 18.0% and 17.8%, and the respective average yield on contract receivables was 9.4% and 9.5%. Originations of $1,075.7&nbsp;million in 2016
	increased $82.0&nbsp;million, or 8.3%, from 2015 levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services expenses primarily include personnel-related and
	other general and administrative costs, as well as provisions for credit losses. These expenses are generally more dependent on changes in the financial services portfolio than they are on the revenue of the segment. Financial services expenses of
	$82.7&nbsp;million in 2016 increased from $70.1&nbsp;million last year primarily due to changes in both the size of the portfolio and in the provisions for credit losses. As a percentage of the average financial services portfolio, financial
	services expenses were 4.9% and 4.8% in 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services operating earnings of
	$198.7&nbsp;million in 2016, including $1.8&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $28.5&nbsp;million, or 16.7%, from 2015 levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	See Note 1 and Note 3 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for further information on financial services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Corporate
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	general
	corporate expenses in 2016 of $91.4&nbsp;million decreased $12.8&nbsp;million from $104.2&nbsp;million last year. The year-over-year decrease in general corporate expenses primarily reflects $6.9&nbsp;million of lower pension expense,
	$6.4&nbsp;million of lower stock-based
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(mark-to-market)
</FONT>
</FONT>
	compensation expense and $2.3&nbsp;million of lower stock-based costs associated with the company&#146;s employee
	stock purchase plan, partially offset by $2.8&nbsp;million of higher acquisition-related and other costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_14"></A>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net sales
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net sales of $889.8&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased
	$38.1&nbsp;million, or 4.5%, from 2015 levels, reflecting a $30.0&nbsp;million, or 3.6%, organic sales gain and $23.3&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales, partially offset by $15.2&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Gross profit of $443.9&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to $412.3&nbsp;million last year. Gross margin of
	49.9% in the quarter improved 150 bps from 48.4% last year primarily due to benefits from higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating expenses of $267.8&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to $250.0&nbsp;million last year. The operating expense margin of 30.1% in the quarter increased 80 bps from 29.3% last
	year primarily due to 60 bps of higher acquisition-related and other expenses, including operating expenses for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	and Sturtevant Richmont, and a 30 bps benefit
	realized in the fourth quarter of 2015 primarily from a gain on the sale of a former manufacturing facility, partially offset by 20 bps of lower pension expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating earnings before financial services of $176.1&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016, including $3.7&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $13.8&nbsp;million, or
	8.5%, as compared to $162.3&nbsp;million last year. As a percentage of net sales, operating earnings before financial services of 19.8% in the quarter improved 70 bps from 19.1% last year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services revenue of $74.2&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to revenue of $63.1&nbsp;million last year.
	Financial services operating earnings of $51.6&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016, including $0.6&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $6.6&nbsp;million, or 14.7%, as compared to $45.0&nbsp;million last year. The
	year-over-year increases in both revenue and operating earnings primarily reflect continued growth of the company&#146;s financial services portfolio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating earnings of $227.7&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016, including $4.3&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $20.4&nbsp;million, or 9.8%, from
	$207.3&nbsp;million last year. As a percentage of revenues, operating earnings of 23.6% in the quarter improved 90 bps from 22.7% last year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest expense of $13.1&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased $0.1&nbsp;million from $13.0&nbsp;million last year. See Note 9 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	debt and credit facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other income (expense) &#150; net was expense of
	$0.3&nbsp;million and $0.5&nbsp;million in the respective fourth quarters of 2016 and 2015. See Note 16 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on other income (expense) &#150; net.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	fourth quarter effective income tax rate on earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	was 30.8% in 2016 and 31.1% in 2015. See Note 8 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on income taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	of $146.3&nbsp;million, or $2.47 per diluted share, in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased $14.9&nbsp;million, or $0.25 per
	diluted share, from 2015 levels. Net earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	in the fourth quarter of 2015 were $131.4&nbsp;million or $2.22 per diluted share.
</FONT>
</P>

	2016 ANNUAL REPORT

<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<I>
	Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
	(continued)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $286.3&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased
	$4.5&nbsp;million, or 1.6%, from 2015 levels, reflecting a $6.5&nbsp;million, or 2.4%, organic sales gain and $4.2&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales, partially offset by $6.2&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The
	organic sales increase primarily includes a high single-digit gain in the segment&#146;s European-based hand tools business and a low single-digit increase to customers in critical industries, largely as a result of higher sales to the military.
	These organic sales gains were partially offset by a mid single-digit decline in the segment&#146;s power tools operations and a low single-digit decline in the segment&#146;s Asia/Pacific operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross profit of $115.4&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to $107.6&nbsp;million last year. Gross margin of
	40.3% in the quarter improved 210 bps from 38.2% last year primarily due to benefits from higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives, and 100 bps of favorable foreign currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of $71.5&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to $65.7&nbsp;million last year. The operating
	expense margin of 25.0% in the quarter increased 170 bps from 23.3% last year primarily due to higher costs, including operating expenses for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	and Sturtevant
	Richmont, a 70 bps benefit realized in the fourth quarter of 2015 from a gain on the sale of a former manufacturing facility, and 10 bps of unfavorable foreign currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of these factors, segment operating earnings of $43.9&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016, including $1.8&nbsp;million
	of favorable foreign currency effects, increased $2.0&nbsp;million from 2015 levels. Operating margin for the Commercial&nbsp;&amp; Industrial Group of 15.3% in the fourth quarter of 2016 improved 40 bps from 14.9% last year.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_16"></A>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $417.5&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased $6.3&nbsp;million, or
	1.5%, from 2015 levels, reflecting a $12.2&nbsp;million, or 3.0%, organic sales gain partially offset by $5.9&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The organic sales increase includes a low single-digit gain in the company&#146;s
	U.S. franchise operations and a mid single-digit gain in the company&#146;s international franchise operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross
	profit of $175.5&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to $173.7&nbsp;million last year. Gross margin of 42.0% in the quarter declined 20 bps from 42.2% last year as 60 bps of unfavorable foreign currency effects were partially offset
	by benefits from higher sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of $102.0&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to
	$101.8&nbsp;million last year. The operating expense margin of 24.4% in the quarter improved 30 bps from 24.7% last year primarily due to sales volume leverage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of these factors, segment operating earnings of $73.5&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016, including $3.8&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased
	$1.6&nbsp;million from 2015 levels. Operating margin for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools Group of 17.6% in the fourth quarter of 2016 improved 10 bps from 17.5% last year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $319.8&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased $39.2&nbsp;million, or
	14.0%, from 2015 levels, reflecting a $24.6&nbsp;million, or 8.9%, organic sales gain and $19.1&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales, partially offset by $4.5&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The organic sales increase
	includes a double-digit gain in sales of diagnostic and repair information products to independent repair shop owners and managers, a mid single-digit increase in sales to OEM dealerships and a low single-digit gain in sales of undercar equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross profit of $153.0&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to $131.0&nbsp;million last year. Gross
	margin of 47.8% in the quarter improved 110 bps from 46.7% last year primarily due to benefits from higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of $70.5&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 compared to $58.9&nbsp;million last year. The operating expense margin of 22.0% increased 100 bps from 21.0% last year
	primarily due to 90 bps of impact from the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of these factors, segment operating earnings of $82.5&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016, including $1.7&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased
	$10.4&nbsp;million from 2015 levels. Operating margin for the Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information Group of 25.8% in the fourth quarter of 2016 improved 10 bps from 25.7% last year.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;14.7%&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PX">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services revenue of $74.2&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased
	$11.1&nbsp;million, or 17.6%, from $63.1&nbsp;million last year primarily reflecting $9.6&nbsp;million of higher revenue as a result of continued growth of the company&#146;s financial services portfolio and $1.3&nbsp;million of increased revenue
	from higher average yields on finance receivables, partially offset by $0.1&nbsp;million of lower revenue from lower average yields on contract receivables. In the fourth quarters of 2016 and 2015, the respective average yield on finance receivables
	was 18.2% and 17.8%, and the respective average yield on contract receivables was 9.3% and 9.5%. Originations of $260.3&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased $8.3&nbsp;million, or 3.3%, from 2015 levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services expenses primarily include personnel-related and other general and administrative costs, as well as provisions for
	credit losses. These expenses are generally more dependent on changes in the financial services portfolio than they are on the revenue of the segment. Financial services expenses of $22.6&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of 2016 increased from
	$18.1&nbsp;million last year primarily due to changes in both the size of the portfolio and in the provisions for credit losses. As a percentage of the average financial services portfolio, financial services expenses were 1.3% and 1.2% in the
	fourth quarters of 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services operating earnings of $51.6&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of
	2016, including $0.6&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $6.6&nbsp;million, or 14.7%, from 2015 levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	See Note 1 and Note 3 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for further information on financial services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Corporate
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	fourth
	quarter 2016 general corporate expenses of $23.8&nbsp;million increased $0.2&nbsp;million from $23.6&nbsp;million last year primarily due to higher acquisition-related and other costs partially offset by $1.6&nbsp;million of lower pension expense.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
	Percentage Disclosure: All income statement line item percentages below &#147;Operating earnings from financial services&#148; are
	calculated as a percentage of the sum of Net sales and Financial services revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	2015 fiscal year contained 52 weeks of operating results.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	2014 fiscal year contained 53 weeks of operating results. The impact of the additional week of operations in fiscal 2014 was not material to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	full
	year 2014 net sales or net earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net sales of $3,352.8&nbsp;million in 2015 increased $75.1&nbsp;million, or 2.3%, from
	2014 levels, reflecting a $220.8&nbsp;million, or 7.1%, organic sales gain and $12.0&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales, partially offset by $157.7&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Gross profit of $1,648.3&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to $1,584.3&nbsp;million in 2014.
	Gross margin of 49.2% in 2015 improved 90 bps from 48.3% in 2014 primarily due to benefits from higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives, as well as 20 bps of lower restructuring costs. Restructuring costs included in gross profit were zero and
	$5.7&nbsp;million in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating expenses of $1,053.7&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to
	$1,048.7&nbsp;million in 2014. The operating expense margin of 31.5% in 2015 improved 50 bps from 32.0% in 2014 primarily due to sales volume leverage and savings from RCI initiatives, partially offset by 20 bps of higher pension expense.
	Restructuring costs included in operating expenses were zero and $0.8&nbsp;million in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating
	earnings before financial services of $594.6&nbsp;million in 2015, including $39.5&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $59.0&nbsp;million, or 11.0%, as compared to $535.6&nbsp;million in 2014. As a percentage of net
	sales, operating earnings before financial services of 17.7% in 2015 improved 140 bps from 16.3% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services
	revenue of $240.3&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to revenue of $214.9&nbsp;million in 2014. Financial services operating earnings of $170.2&nbsp;million in 2015, including $2.6&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased
	$21.1&nbsp;million, or 14.2%, as compared to $149.1&nbsp;million in 2014. The year-over-year increases in both revenue and operating earnings primarily reflect continued growth of the company&#146;s financial services portfolio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating earnings of $764.8&nbsp;million in 2015, including $42.1&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased
	$80.1&nbsp;million, or 11.7%, from $684.7&nbsp;million in 2014. As a percentage of revenues, operating earnings of 21.3% in 2015 improved 170 bps from 19.6% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Interest expense of $51.9&nbsp;million in 2015 decreased $1.0&nbsp;million from $52.9&nbsp;million in 2014. See Note 9 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	debt and credit facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Other income (expense) &#150; net was expense of
	$2.4&nbsp;million and $0.9&nbsp;million in 2015 and 2014, respectively. See Note 16 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on other income (expense) &#150; net.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	effective income tax rate on earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	was 31.7% in 2015 and 32.1% in 2014. See Note 8 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on income taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	of $478.7&nbsp;million, or $8.10 per diluted share, in 2015 increased $56.8&nbsp;million, or $0.96 per diluted share, from 2014
	levels. Net earnings attributable to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	in 2014 were $421.9&nbsp;million or $7.14 per diluted share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Exit and Disposal Activities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	did not record any costs for exit and disposal activities in 2015;
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	recorded $6.5&nbsp;million of costs for exit and disposal activities in 2014. See Note 7 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for information on
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	exit and disposal activities.
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<I>
	Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
	(continued)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $1,163.6&nbsp;million in 2015 decreased $11.2&nbsp;million, or
	1.0%, from 2014 levels, reflecting $75.3&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation partially offset by a $64.1&nbsp;million, or 5.8%, organic sales gain. The organic sales increase primarily included a double-digit gain in the
	segment&#146;s power tools operations and high single-digit increases from both the segment&#146;s European-based hand tools business and Asia/Pacific operations; sales to customers in critical industries were essentially flat, as sales gains in
	several market segments were generally offset by lower sales to customers in the oil and gas sector of our natural resources market segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross profit of $446.5&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to $449.7&nbsp;million in 2014. Gross margin of 38.4% in 2015 improved 10 bps from 38.3% in 2014, as savings from RCI initiatives were
	partially offset by a shift in sales that included higher volumes of lower gross margin products, including increased sales from the segment&#146;s power tools and Asia/Pacific operations. Restructuring costs included in gross profit were zero and
	$1.0&nbsp;million in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of $277.1&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to
	$291.1&nbsp;million in 2014. The operating expense margin of 23.8% in 2015 improved 100 bps from 24.8% in 2014 primarily due to benefits from the sales shift noted above and a 20 bps gain from the sale of a former manufacturing facility.
	Restructuring costs included in operating expenses were zero and $0.4&nbsp;million in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a
	result of these factors, segment operating earnings of $169.4&nbsp;million in 2015, including $7.7&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $10.8&nbsp;million from 2014 levels. Operating margin for the Commercial&nbsp;&amp;
	Industrial Group of 14.6% in 2015 improved 110 bps from 13.5% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Gross profit
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $1,568.7&nbsp;million in 2015 increased $113.5&nbsp;million, or 7.8%, from 2014
	levels, reflecting a $154.2&nbsp;million, or 10.9%, organic sales gain partially offset by $40.7&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The organic sales increase included double-digit gains in both the company&#146;s U.S. and
	international franchise operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross profit of $683.0&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to $630.3&nbsp;million in
	2014. Gross margin of 43.5% in 2015 improved 20 bps from 43.3% in 2014 primarily due to benefits from higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives, partially offset by 90 bps of unfavorable foreign currency effects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of $427.0&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to $407.2&nbsp;million in 2014. The operating expense margin of 27.2%
	in 2015 improved 80 bps from 28.0% in 2014 primarily due to sales volume leverage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of these factors, segment
	operating earnings of $256.0&nbsp;million in 2015, including $21.3&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $32.9&nbsp;million from 2014 levels. Operating margin for the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	Tools
	Group of 16.3% in 2015 improved 100 bps from 15.3% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment net sales of $1,113.2&nbsp;million in 2015 increased $18.0&nbsp;million, or
	1.6%, from 2014 levels, reflecting a $51.8&nbsp;million, or 4.9%, organic sales gain and $12.0&nbsp;million of acquisition-related sales, partially offset by $45.8&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency translation. The organic sales increase
	primarily included mid single-digit gains in sales of undercar equipment, sales to OEM dealerships, and sales of diagnostic and repair information products to independent repair shop owners and managers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment gross profit of $518.8&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to $504.3&nbsp;million in 2014. Gross margin of 46.6% in 2015 improved 60
	bps from 46.0% in 2014 primarily due to contributions from higher sales and savings from RCI initiatives, and 40 bps of lower restructuring costs. These gross margin improvements were partially offset by a shift in sales that included higher volumes
	of lower gross margin products, including increased essential tool and facilitation sales to OEM dealerships. Restructuring costs included in gross profit were zero and $4.7&nbsp;million in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Segment operating expenses of $245.4&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to $253.1&nbsp;million in 2014. The operating expense margin of 22.0%
	in 2015 improved 110 bps from 23.1% in 2014 primarily due to sales volume leverage, including benefits from the sales shift noted above, and savings from RCI initiatives. Restructuring costs included in operating expenses were zero and
	$0.4&nbsp;million in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As a result of these factors, segment operating earnings of
	$273.4&nbsp;million in 2015, including $10.5&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $22.2&nbsp;million from 2014 levels. Operating margin for the Repair Systems&nbsp;&amp; Information Group of 24.6% in 2015 improved 170 bps
	from 22.9% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services revenue of $240.3&nbsp;million in 2015 increased $25.4&nbsp;million, or 11.8%, from
	$214.9&nbsp;million in 2014 primarily reflecting $23.0&nbsp;million of higher revenue as a result of continued growth of the company&#146;s financial services portfolio and $2.2&nbsp;million of increased revenue from higher average yields on finance
	receivables. In 2015 and 2014, the average yield on finance receivables was 17.8% and 17.6%, respectively, and the average yield on contract receivables was 9.5% in both years. Originations of $993.7&nbsp;million in 2015 increased
	$105.1&nbsp;million, or 11.8%, from 2014 levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services expenses of $70.1&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to
	$65.8&nbsp;million in 2014. As a percentage of the average financial services portfolio, financial services expenses were 4.8% and 5.1% in 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Financial services operating earnings of $170.2&nbsp;million in 2015, including $2.6&nbsp;million of unfavorable foreign currency effects, increased $21.1&nbsp;million, or 14.2%, from 2014 levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	See Note 1 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for further information on financial services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Corporate
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	general corporate expenses in 2015 of $104.2&nbsp;million increased $6.9&nbsp;million from $97.3&nbsp;million in 2014 primarily due to $7.9&nbsp;million of higher pension expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

	Non-GAAP

	Supplemental Data
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The supplemental Operations data reflects the results of operations and financial
	position of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	tools, diagnostic and equipment products, software and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-financial
</FONT>
	services operations with Financial Services on the equity method.
	The supplemental Financial Services data reflects the results of operations and financial position of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	U.S. and international financial services operations. The financing needs of Financial
	Services are met through intersegment borrowings and cash generated from Operations; Financial Services is charged interest expense on intersegment borrowings at market rates. Income taxes are charged to Financial Services on the basis of the
	specific tax attributes generated by the U.S. and international financial services businesses. Transactions between the Operations and Financial Services businesses were eliminated to arrive at the Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D308837D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	growth has historically been funded by a combination of cash provided by operating
	activities and debt financing. On January&nbsp;17, 2017,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	repaid $150&nbsp;million of unsecured 5.50% notes (the &#147;2017 Notes&#148;) upon maturity with available cash and cash generated from
	issuances of commercial paper.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	believes that its cash from operations and collections of finance receivables, coupled with its sources of borrowings and available cash on hand, are sufficient to fund
	its currently anticipated requirements for scheduled debt payments (including the January&nbsp;15, 2018 repayment of $250&nbsp;million of unsecured 4.25% notes at maturity (the &#147;2018 Notes&#148;)), payments of interest and dividends, new
	receivables originated by our financial services businesses, capital expenditures, working capital, the funding of pension plans, and funding for share repurchases and acquisitions, as they arise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Due to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	credit rating over the years, external funds have been available at an
	acceptable cost. As of the close of business on February&nbsp;3, 2017,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on&#146;s
</FONT>
	long-term debt and commercial paper were rated, respectively, A3 and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	P-2
</FONT>
	by
	Moody&#146;s Investors Service;
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	A-
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	A-2
</FONT>
	by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s; and A and F1 by Fitch Ratings.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	believes
	that its current credit arrangements are sound and that the strength of its balance sheet affords the company the financial flexibility, including through access to financial markets for potential new financing, to respond to both internal growth
	opportunities and those available through acquisitions. However,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Snap-on
</FONT>
	cannot provide any assurances of the availability of future financing or the terms on which it might be available, or that its debt
	ratings may not decrease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following discussion focuses on information included in the accompanying Consolidated Balance
	Sheets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of 2016 year end, working capital (current assets less current liabilities) of $894.5&nbsp;million decreased
	$224.1&nbsp;million from $1,118.6&nbsp;million as of 2015 year end primarily as a result of the inclusion of the 2017 Notes and $130&nbsp;million of outstanding commercial paper borrowings in &#147;Notes payable and current maturities of long-term
	debt,&#148; partially offset by the other net changes in working capital discussed below. As of 2015 year end, the 2017 Notes were included in &#147;Long-term debt&#148; on the accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheet as their scheduled maturity was
	in excess of one year of the 2015
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	balance sheet date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following
	represents the company&#146;s working capital position as of 2016 and 2015 year end:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Cash and cash equivalents of $77.6&nbsp;million as of 2016 year end decreased $15.2&nbsp;million from
	2015
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	levels primarily due to (i)&nbsp;the funding of $915.0&nbsp;million of new finance receivables; (ii)&nbsp;the funding of $160.4&nbsp;million, net of cash acquired, for the acquisitions of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Car-O-Liner
</FONT>
</FONT>
	and Sturtevant Richmont; (iii)&nbsp;dividend payments to shareholders of $147.5&nbsp;million; (iv)&nbsp;the repurchase of 758,000 shares of the company&#146;s
	common stock for $120.4&nbsp;million; and (v)&nbsp;the funding of $74.3&nbsp;million of capital expenditures. These decreases in cash and cash equivalents were partially offset by (i) $671.7&nbsp;million of cash from collections of finance
	receivables; (ii) $576.1&nbsp;million of cash generated from operations, net of $60.0&nbsp;million of discretionary cash contributions to the company&#146;s domestic pension plans; (iii) $134.2&nbsp;million of net proceeds from notes payable and
	other short-term borrowings; and (iv) $41.8&nbsp;million of cash proceeds from stock purchase and option plan exercises.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
